Title: Pygmalion
Cast: Leslie Howard, Wendy Hiller, Wilfrid Lawson, Marie Lohr, Scott Sunderland, Jean Cadell, David Tree, Everley Gregg, Leueen MacGrath, Esme Percy, Violet Vanbrugh, Iris Hoey, Viola Tree, Irene Browne, Kate Cutler
Plot: Shaw's play in which a Victorian dialect expert bets that he can teach a lower-class girl to speak proper English and thus be taken for a lady. The snobbish & intellectual Professor of languages, Henry Higgins makes a bet with his friend that he can take a London flower seller, Eliza Doolittle, from the gutters and pass her off as a society lady. However he discovers that this involves dealing with a human being with ideas of her own. Written by Steve Crook <steve@brainstorm.co.uk>
Location: Pinewood Studios, Iver Heath, Buckinghamshire, England, UK
Actors: Leslie Howard, Wendy Hiller, Wilfrid Lawson
Writer: George Bernard Shaw (play) (as Bernard Shaw), George Bernard Shaw (scenario and dialogue) (as Bernard Shaw) | 2 more credits »
Description: Directed by Anthony Asquith, Leslie Howard.  With Leslie Howard, Wendy Hiller, Wilfrid Lawson, Marie Lohr. Shaw's play in which a Victorian dialect expert bets that he can teach a lower-class girl to speak proper English and thus be taken for a lady.
